name: Shalin Mody
text: Very much a spiritual, come as you are kinda place.  Very warm, welcoming folks that you'd want to have as your neighbors.  Also pretty great choir and lots of well informed and wise folks happy to be of service to each other.

name: Will Koehrsen
text: A welcoming Unitarian Universalist congregation. As a complete outsider, I was made to feel like I belonged from the first service. The Unitarians are some of the nicest religious people because they don't try to force their faith onto you: it's your choice whether or not you believe and they don't endorse any one deity. Overall, I'd recommend trying out a Unitarian Universalist congregation (maybe this one) if you are looking to get into religion but feel put off by traditional options.

name: VariantPlays
text: Not my thing. Good place for anyone who is interested just not my thing.

name: Brock Prescott
text: Great sermons, very inclusive, rotating religious views allows for a great all encompassing experience of us as complex humans

name: Joy Grace
text: i felt so very welcome & everyone was so very kind! That is how church should feel to everyone! I felt as if I was definitely supposed to be there today & tomorrow as well!! Thank you everyone for being so informative and very helpful!  I have been praying for this! much love here! :)

name: Latoya Davis
text: I love this church it's the best i ♥️ the people there you just got to join the church you will love it too

name: Kathy Heath
text: Warm and friendly, a group of people who have a set of principles to live by, all are welcome

name: LaDawn Edwards
text: Welcoming congregation emphasizes music and families.  All configurations of families seem to thrive in this liberal religious home.

name: Jack Long
text: UUCH is a welcoming congregation. I have been a member since 1991. We welcome you to join us.

name: Tamara Morton
text: My year-long membership here revealed a superficially friendly church with a herd-like mentality for gossip and judging others, exempting some lovely individual members. The truth is that organizations are made up of flawed individuals, myself included, and this church is no different from others, despite claims to the contrary.

name: Amanda McClellan
text: Very high calibration and extremely welcoming and open minded. There needs to be more churches like this. The people and the whole place vibrate at a very high level of consciousness through God's loving light. God bless them. I will be back.

name: Amanda McClellan
text: I love this church. I only went once since my husband and I attend a Methodist church but I would love to come back. What open minded fully loving people. They are truly Godly people that calibrate on a very high scale of consciousness.

name: Falon Yates
text: I went here with friends from my Psychology of Religion class, and we loved it. I'm not religious, and as a bisexual female scientist living in the South, I don't usually feel very welcome in churches. The UU congregation were a wonderful surprise. They had a lovely, thought-provoking service that welcomed diverse points of view and encouraged discussion. I'm happy to know that there's a place like that in the Shoals, and would absolutely attend again.

name: Ken Johnson
text: Wonderful little congregation.  I really enjoy the fellowship there when I’m in Florence.

name: Robin Featherston
text: I have never felt so welcomed as I do here. How refreshing to be in a place that accepts all without judgement.
